snippet: Back in the 1996 Presidential election, California sought to increase its political clout as the nation's most delegate-rich state by bumping up its primary date by more than two months, to the last Tuesday in March from the long-accustomed first ...
lead_paragraph: Back in the 1996 Presidential election, California sought to increase its political clout as the nation's most delegate-rich state by bumping up its primary date by more than two months, to the last Tuesday in March from the long-accustomed first Tuesday in June. So many states had moved up their primary dates over the years, the thinking went, that the nomination often was already sewn up by the time the Golden State's primary rolled around. The plan didn't work.
abstract: California weighs moving date of primary for Presidential election of 2000 to March 7, from long-accustomed first Tuesday in June (S)

headline.main: Political Briefing; California Is Trying For Early-Bird Vote
